column1: Table 11. Successful program completion, by type of problem-solving court, 2012
Report title: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012 NCJ 249803
Data source: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, Ph.D., and Ramona R. Rantala, Tracey Kyckelhahn, Ph.D.
Table 11. Successful program completion, by type of problem-solving court, 2012
Note: Detail may not sum to total due to rounding. See appendix table 18 for standard errors.
a/Based on the weighted responses and rounded to the nearest whole number.
b/Percentages are based on 80.2% item response.
c/Handles alcohol- or drug-dependent offenders also charged with a driving offense.
d/Percentages are based on 40% item response rate. Interpret with caution.
e/Percentages are based on less than 70% item response. Interpret with caution.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012.
